title: Purchase a Guitar and Accessories
description: Research and buy a suitable beginner guitar (acoustic or electric). Purchase picks, a tuner, a strap (if electric), and a case.

title: Learn Basic Guitar Anatomy and Tuning
description: Identify the parts of the guitar. Learn how to tune the guitar using a tuner app or device.

title: Practice Basic Chords (Week 1-2)
description: Focus on learning and practicing basic chords like E, A, D, G, C, and Am. Practice transitioning between chords smoothly.

title: Learn Basic Strumming Patterns (Week 3-4)
description: Practice basic strumming patterns like down-down-up-up-down-up. Apply these patterns to the chords you've learned.

title: Practice Simple Songs (Week 5-6)
description: Choose a few simple songs that use the chords and strumming patterns you've learned. Practice playing along with a recording.

title: Learn Barre Chords (Week 7-8)
description: Start learning basic barre chords like F and Bm. These can be challenging, so be patient and persistent.

title: Explore Fingerpicking (Week 9-10)
description: Introduce simple fingerpicking patterns using your thumb and fingers. Start with easy arrangements of songs you already know.

title: Learn a New Song Each Week (Week 11-12)
description: Challenge yourself to learn a new song each week that incorporates the skills you've been developing.

title: Review and Practice
description: Dedicate time to review all the chords, strumming patterns, and songs you've learned over the past 12 weeks.

title: Consider Guitar Lessons
description: Evaluate your progress and consider taking guitar lessons to further improve your skills and receive personalized guidance.

title: Join an Online Guitar Community
description: Engage with other guitar learners online for support, tips, and inspiration.

title: Regular Practice (Daily/Every Other Day)
description: Commit to practicing regularly, even if it's just for 15-30 minutes each day. Consistency is key to improving your guitar skills.
